channel.title: SkillCape help!

item.title: SkillCape help!
item.dc:creator: @server868 server868
item.description:
@server868 wrote:

If you are still having problems, I can help

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4347)
{
//prayer

    stillgfx(652, absY, absX, 0, 0);

    stillgfx(652, absY, absX, 0, 20);

    stillgfx(84, absY, absX);

    stillgfx(263, absY, absX);

    stillgfx(264, absY, absX);

    stillgfx(426, absY, absX);

    stillgfx(444, absY, absX);

    stillgfx(574, absY, absX);

    stillgfx(199, absY, absX);
    setAnimation(2047);
    updateRequired = true;
    appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

Try that format. It got my capes going. The only problem is, where did you find your skillcape button… Mine is not in client.java… I dont think it is anyways…

Read full topic

item.title: SkillCape help!
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

I have the case set right but when i try to compile i get this error

Were compiling wait please!

client.java:24017: class, interface, or enum expected
public void c.capeEmote() {
^
client.java:24020: class, interface, or enum expected
stillgfx(427, absY, absX);
^
client.java:24021: class, interface, or enum expected
stillgfx(83, absY, absX);
^
client.java:24022: class, interface, or enum expected
}
^
4 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

In my client.java it looks like this at very bottom
public void c.capeEmote() {
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 3777) {
stillgfx(246, absY, absX);
stillgfx(427, absY, absX);
stillgfx(83, absY, absX);
}
}

My case looks like this

case 74077:
capeEmote();
break;

Any idea’s? =\

item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

stoneboyjosh:

i know that it is basically impossible, but I’m going to try anyways…

It’s possible to add skillcape emotes. Lots of people have done it, most servers since 2008 have it… Some don’t have the same as RuneScape, but they do have skillcape emotes.

P.S - Do what Adam says and it will work.

item.title: SkillCape help!
item.dc:creator: @stoneboyjosh stoneboyjosh
item.description:
@stoneboyjosh wrote:

Hey guys, I was just recently adding skillcape emotes to my server, not my client. I don’t know if that is correct or what. But, I compiled it and got no errors. I put it under a public void. I found one at the END of my client.java file and just stuck it there. Here it is:

public void capeEmote() {
 if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 3777) {
        stillgfx(246, absY, absX);
        stillgfx(427, absY, absX);
        stillgfx(83, absY, absX);
 }
 }

I think this is attack. I don’t know for sure…lolz. Anyways, my problem is getting the skillcape emote to work! I have an actual skillcape emote button, but when I click it, it says skillcapes are currently unavailable and does nothing. here is my skillcape button:

case 74077:
// scared
c.sM(“Skillcape emotes currently are unavabile”);
break;

at least i think that is.
SOMEBODY PLEASE HELP!!! (yes, I am using a 317. AND YES, i know that it is basically impossible, but I’m going to try anyways…)

Read full topic
